com.label305.stan.geofencing

Class GeofenceRemover

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.label305.stan.geofencing.GeofenceRemover
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.android.gms.common.GooglePlayServicesClient.ConnectionCallbacks, com.google.android.gms.common.GooglePlayServicesClient.OnConnectionFailedListener, com.google.android.gms.location.LocationClient.OnRemoveGeofencesResultListener

    public class GeofenceRemover
extends Object
implements com.google.android.gms.common.GooglePlayServicesClient.ConnectionCallbacks, com.google.android.gms.common.GooglePlayServicesClient.OnConnectionFailedListener, com.google.android.gms.location.LocationClient.OnRemoveGeofencesResultListener
    Class for connecting to Location Services and removing geofences.

    Note: Clients must ensure that Google Play services is available before removing geofences. Use GooglePlayServicesUtil.isGooglePlayServicesAvailable() to check.

    To use a GeofenceRemover, instantiate it, then call either RemoveGeofencesById() or RemoveGeofencesByIntent(). Everything else is done automatically.

      • setInProgressFlag

        public void setInProgressFlag(boolean flag)
        Set the "in progress" flag from a caller. This allows callers to re-set a request that failed but was later fixed.
        Parameters:
        flag - Turn the in progress flag on or off.

      • removeGeofencesById

        public void removeGeofencesById(List<String> geofenceIds)
                         throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                UnsupportedOperationException
        Remove the geofences in a list of geofence IDs. To remove all current geofences associated with a request, you can also call removeGeofencesByIntent.

        Note: The List must contain at least one ID, otherwise an Exception is thrown

        Parameters:
        geofenceIds - A List of geofence IDs
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException
        UnsupportedOperationException
